solution_line_template: First calculate the volume of the aquarium by multiplying its length, width and height: {length} ft * {width} ft * {height} ft = <<{length}*{width}*{height}={aquarium_volume}>>{aquarium_volume} cubic ft
Then figure out what proportion of the aquarium is full after the cat knocks it over: {initial_fill_fraction} * {spill_fraction} = {after_spill_fraction}
Then figure out what proportion of the aquarium is full after Nancy refills it: {refill_multiplier} * {after_spill_fraction} = {after_refill_fraction}

Now multiply the proportion of the aquarium that's full by the aquarium's volume to find out how much water is in it: {aquarium_volume} cubic ft * {after_refill_fraction} = <<{aquarium_volume}*{after_refill_fraction}={final_water_volume}>>{final_water_volume} cubic ft
